pr_title: Add sample for the Secret Manager integration

timeline.bodyText: You can also demonstrate the use of @Value here, just to inject a String property.

+package com.example;
+
+import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
+import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Value;
+import org.springframework.core.env.Environment;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;
+
+@RestController
+public class WebController {
+
+	@Autowired
+	private Environment environment;
+
+	@Autowired
+	private MyAppProperties properties;
+
+	// Application secrets can also be accessed using @Value and passing in the secret name.
